title: Siege at French museum as man makes threats to police in Arabic
text:
At least one man is holed up at a museum in southern France, where threatening messages in Arabic have been written on the building's walls.

Officers surrounded the archaeology museum in the Mediterranean town of Saint-Raphael this morning, where the man, possibly with an accomplice, broke in overnight and refused to communicate with police.

Police were alerted to the man by a housekeeper, who found an Arabic inscription on the wall upon her arrival for work, as reported by BFMTV.

One of the inscriptions is understood to say 'the museum will become a hell.'

Sebastian, an employee at the Duplex restaurant opposite the museum, told the local Nice-Matin newspaper: 'The entire neighbourhood is locked down... We've been ordered to stay in the restaurant.'

Police have advised people to avoid the area if possible.

It is not known if the man is armed or not, or if he has any hostages.

The museum, a historic monument, includes a medieval stone church and a vast collection of amphoras - a type of container - and other items from the region's Roman history.

The historic town is tucked between Cannes and Saint-Tropez.

More to follow...
